questions.question_text: A convex lens has a focal length of 10 cm. What is the image distance for an object distance of 15 cm?
questions.explanation: By using lens formula 1/f = 1/v - 1/u, where f is the focal length, v is the image distance and u is the object distance, we can solve for v to get 30 cm.

questions.question_text: What happens when a ray of light strikes a glass surface at an incidence angle of 90 degrees?

options.A: It is refracted at an angle of 90 degrees
options.B: It is reflected back into the medium
options.C: It is absorbed by the glass
options.D: It passes straight through without deviation

questions.explanation: When the incidence angle is 90 degrees, the ray of light strikes the glass surface normally (perpendicularly), and there is no deviation of the light ray. It passes straight through the glass surface.

questions.question_text: A block of mass m is in equilibrium under the action of force F and friction f. Which of the following conditions must be true?
questions.explanation: In equilibrium, net force acting on the body is zero. So, the applied force F should be equal to the friction force f.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT an optical instrument?
questions.explanation: A thermometer is not an optical instrument. It is a device used for measuring temperature.

questions.question_text: The resolving power of a microscope is directly related to which of the following?

options.B: The size of the objective lens
options.C: The distance between the objective lens and the specimen

questions.explanation: The resolving power of a microscope is directly related to the wavelength of the light used. Shorter wavelengths yield higher resolution.

questions.question_text: In a double-slit experiment, if the wavelength of light and the distance between slits are both increased, what happens to the fringe spacing?
questions.explanation: The fringe spacing in a double-slit experiment is directly proportional to both the wavelength of light used and the distance between the slits. Therefore, if both are increased, the fringe spacing will increase.

questions.question_text: A block of mass m is pulled on a horizontal frictionless surface by a force F. What is the acceleration of the block?
questions.explanation: According to Newton's second law of motion, acceleration is directly proportional to the net force and inversely proportional to the mass of the object. Hence, acceleration = F/m.

questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes diffraction?

options.A: The bending of light as it passes through a narrow opening
options.B: The reflection of light off a surface
options.C: The splitting of light into its constituent colors
options.D: The absorption of light by a medium

questions.explanation: Diffraction is the bending of light as it passes around an obstacle or through a narrow opening.

questions.question_text: In a pulley system, if the tension in the rope is increased, what happens to the acceleration of the system?
questions.explanation: The acceleration in a pulley system is directly proportional to the tension in the rope. So, if tension is increased, the acceleration of the system will also increase.

questions.question_text: What does Newton's third law of motion state?

options.A: Every action has an equal and opposite reaction
options.C: An object at rest tends to stay at rest
options.D: The rate of change of momentum of a body is directly proportional to the force applied

questions.explanation: Newton's third law of motion states that for every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.
